required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Corrected VA With Long-Term Follow-Up After AcrySof® Intraocular Lens (IOL) Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: Corrected VA With Long-Term Follow-Up After AcrySof® IOL Implantation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the long-term visual acuity (VA) with an acrylic IOL to a silicone or polymethylmethacrylate (PMMA) IOL in cataract patients. This study will take place in Japan.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) at the Long-Term, Post-Implantation Visit
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to and including 3 months after implantation), long-term post-implantation visit (14-20 years after implantation)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of best corrected (with spectacles or other visual corrective devices) visual acuity (at both near and distance). Visual Acuity (VA) is measured in logMAR (logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution). A lower logMAR value indicates better visual acuity. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

arm_group.description: Acrylic IOL, prior implantation (1994-2000) in one or both eyes
Silicone IOL, prior implantation (1994-2000) in one or both eyes
PMMA IOL, prior implantation (1994-2000) in one or both eyes

intervention.description: Acrylic IOL for long-term implantation in the cataract patient
Silicone IOL for long-term implantation in the cataract patient
Polymethylmethacrylate IOL for long-term implantation in the cataract patient

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 11 study centers located in Japan.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 104 enrolled, 6 subjects were exited as screen failures and deemed ineligible for participation. This reporting group includes all eligible subjects (98).

group.title: AcrySof
group.description: Acrylic IOL, prior implantation (1994-2000) in one or both eyes

group.description: Silicone IOL, prior implantation (1994-2000) in one or both eyes

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who used the study devices and underwent the long-term post-implantation visit examination (Safety Set).

group.title: AcrySof
group.description: Acrylic IOL, prior implantation (1994-2000) in one or both eyes

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) at the Long-Term, Post-Implantation Visit
outcome.description: Measurement of best corrected (with spectacles or other visual corrective devices) visual acuity (at both near and distance). Visual Acuity (VA) is measured in logMAR (logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution). A lower logMAR value indicates better visual acuity. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (up to and including 3 months after implantation), long-term post-implantation visit (14-20 years after implantation)
outcome.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who used the study devices and have data after implantation of study devices (Full Analysis Set).

group.title: AcrySof
group.description: Acrylic IOL, prior implantation (1994-2000) in one or both eyes

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) at the Long-Term, Post-Implantation Visit
measure.description: Measurement of best corrected (with spectacles or other visual corrective devices) visual acuity (at both near and distance). Visual Acuity (VA) is measured in logMAR (logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution). A lower logMAR value indicates better visual acuity. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
measure.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who used the study devices and have data after implantation of study devices (Full Analysis Set).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected for the duration of a subject’s participation in the study; retrospectively 14 to 20 years and prospectively for a single visit. This analysis group includes all subjects who used the study devices and underwent the long-term post-implantation visit examination. Ocular adverse events are presented for both study eye and non-study eye combined.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs in subjects, whether or not related to the investigational medical device (test/control article or procedure). AEs are reported retrospectively (onset between Baseline (defined as the period within 3 months after surgery) and Informed Consent acquisition) and prospectively (onset after Informed Consent acquisition).

group.title: AcrySof (Retrospective)
group.description: Subjects with prior implantation of acrylic IOL who experienced an AE related to decrease of BCVA in the study eye

group.title: Silicone (Retrospective)
group.description: Subjects with prior implantation of Silicone IOL who experienced an AE related to decrease of BCVA in the study eye

group.title: PMMA (Retrospective)
group.description: Subjects with prior implantation of PMMA IOL who experienced an AE related to decrease of BCVA in the study eye

group.title: AcrySof (Prospective)
group.description: Subjects with prior implantation of acrylic IOL who experienced an AE with onset after the Informed Consent acquisition

group.title: Silicone (Prospective)
group.description: Subjects with prior implantation of Silicone IOL who experienced an AE with onset after the Informed Consent acquisition

group.title: PMMA (Prospective)
group.description: Subjects with prior implantation of PMMA IOL who experienced an AE with onset after the Informed Consent acquisition

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
